abstract: Google’s new Chrome browser is more than mousework. The company offers a lengthy list of keyboard shortcuts.
snippet: Google’s new Chrome browser is more than mousework. The company offers a lengthy list of keyboard shortcuts.
lead_paragraph: Right-clicking gets you places in Google’s new Chrome browser. For instance, when you have just copied a Web address, right-click on the Chrome address bar and select “Paste and Go” to do just that without having to hit the Enter key. You can also right-click on the Back button to see recent browsing history. But Chrome is more than mousework: Google has a lengthy list of keyboard shortcuts at snipurl.com/3p9tj.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Getting the Most Out of Chrome
